alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 10:00PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kern and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 955 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area through 1215 AM. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Three Rivers, East Porterville, South Fork Campground, Oak Opening, Hockett Meadow Ranger Station, Case Mountain, Springville, Wolverton Point, Quinn Patrol Cabin, Camp Nelson, Wet Meadows, Atwell Mill Campground, Farewell Gap, Ash Mountain Sequoia Park HQ, Cold Springs Campground, Mineral King Ranger Station, Potwisha Campground, Buckeye Flat Campground, Quaking Aspen and Peppermint. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
